Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery wine-jar (?), the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of three lines of black-painted hieratic text at 90 degrees to the rilling marks, giving the ends of lines of an item of accounts.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393460) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393460)
